timeline.message: :art: fixed some sonarqube security hotspots and bugs
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/constellation-app/constellation

:art: added default javafx stylesheets (caspian and modena)
:art: added unit test for vertex type detection and validation
:bug: fixed a couple of issues with type regex strings

:bug: updated PasswordObfuscator and PasswordDeobfuscator to use a secure mode and padding scheme
:art: fixed an incorrect assignment in UndoGraphEditState

oops... i forgot to all all files in the last commit...
:bug: updated PasswordObfuscator and PasswordDeobfuscator to use a secure mode and padding scheme
:art: fixed an incorrect assignment in UndoGraphEditState
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/constellation-app/constellation
:art: renamed scatter arrangement to "Scatter 3D" and updated arrangement menu ordering
:art: updated author name

:art: fixed a minor typo
:art: updated to latest JRE11 (in a previous commit)
:art: updated build script with the correct jre references
Merge branch 'master' into regex-update

:art: added support for double, short and byte attribute types
:art: removed unused 'attr_list' attribute type
:art: updated datetime attribute types to be backed by objects
:art: disabled editor for 'raw' attribute type
:art: ensured validation for all relevent attribute types
:art: normalised code style across attribute classes
:art: updated class headers with the current year
:art: attempting to revert header year update (i'll do this on a seperate branch)
Merge branch 'master' into attribute-update
:art: re-updated some class headers

:art: updated what's new
:art: updated magic string references in Histogram
:art: updated author tags for attribute descriptions which changed significantly

timeline.bodyText: Weren't these changes made in one of your other PRs?
timeline.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: Yep - this branches off that and so contains the same changes.
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: @cygnus-x-1 if that's the case then this PR will have to wait until the regex change gets properly tested. If you wen't off master this would have been better IMHO.
replies.author: arcturus2

timeline.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: I keep forgetting this exists - thanks :)
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.author: antares1470
antares1470

timeline.bodyText: I believe this should be 'random' instead of 'RANDOM' to follow the naming convention
timeline.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: I blindly copy/pasted this... good pick.
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: I know we want to capture as many exceptions here as possible but I still think it might be better to only catch the relevant ones here (e.g. I wouldn't expect an IO exception to occur here)
timeline.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: I originally did convert this to specific exceptions, however later thought that it'd be safer to catch all exceptions since convertFromString is an overridable method.
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: I still think my preference would be catch the specific exceptions rather than the generic catch-all and then adjust the catches as need be. If for no other reason, sonar has a rule for avoiding catching generic exceptions and so if we can avoid introducing unnecessary code smells then that would be a preference
replies.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: I've set convertFromString with a throws IllegalArgumentException, and i'm now explicitely catching that. The problem is that we can't predict what the implementation will actually throw in terms of runtime exceptions, so if anything unplanned happens you will get a nasty popup instead of a message in the editor ui saying the value is invalid. Does this work for you @arcturus2, @antares1470?
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: I'll leave the call to @arcturus2. The nasty pop up isn't ideal but may be a necessary risk. In theory, we could apply this thinking to a lot of functions in the code base but I'm not sure we want to take it that far
replies.author: antares1470

timeline.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: This one, however, can be made specific :)
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.author: antares1470

timeline.bodyText: Believe it or not but sonar reckons the cast is actually necessary (seems to think we re parsing longBitsToDouble an integer)
timeline.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: I don't believe it... but sure, reverted.
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.author: antares1470
antares1470
antares1470
antares1470

timeline.message: :art: changes based on pull request feedback

timeline.bodyText: I think there were a couple instances of this in the lines below that also need to be reverted (casting a long that is)
timeline.author: antares1470

timeline.message: :art: missed a correction
:art: and one more change

timeline.bodyText: Can you walk me through why this case doesn't need to be considered anymore?
timeline.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText: This check is against the long value of a datetime. ZonedDateTimeAttributeDescription.DEFAULT_VALUE is a ZonedDateTime (and defaults to null), so the comparison doesn't make sense. I suspect it was a long at one point in time as the defaults for LocalDateTimeAttributeDescription, DateAttributeDescription and TimeAttributeDescription were all longs - however this would still be bad design as it assumes the user has chosen an attribute backed by ZonedDateTimeAttributeDescription.ATTRIBUTE_TYPE while still supporting attributes backed by other datetime types.
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.message: :art: updated changelog

timeline.bodyText: From what I can tell this is removed because it hasn't been used anywhere by any other class.
timeline.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText: Correct. I think there were a couple of methods I removed from AttributeDescription for the same reason.
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: This feels a bit dangerous - won't we get NPE by not checking for null?
timeline.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText: It's not dangerous as String.valueOf(null) returns "null"... but it does seem wrong and i'm not sure why I changed it to that. It may have just been an oversight - I'll change it back.
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.author: arcturus2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,223 +0,0 @@

-package au.gov.asd.tac.constellation.graph.attribute.compatibility;

replies.bodyText: Yes - this was removed as part of cleaning up and normalising attributes. The issue here is that this attribute type is no longer supported (and can be broken), but because it's still 'registered' as an attribute it is available for use in the Attribute Editor, Delimited File Importer, etc. Rather than update the deprecated class, I figured it was easier to just remove it; after all that is the point of deprecation. Perhaps it's time to update those old graphs?
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText:
Can do (eventually). For now though can we keep them for a bit longer but start with removing the ServiceProvider annotation so they don't appear in the views? Doing this type of cleanup makes sense now that we are in v2 and I'm OK with that - I'll just need the classes around for a bit longer rather than having to troll through git history 😄.
Feel free to add a big comment saying which ones you think are broken too as that will help me.
replies.author: arcturus2
